body_html: I am sadly also in a similar situation trying to deploy on a nation-wide GPU cluster which is really the only access to GPUs that my research group has. We have a module system that can give us access to plenty of modern tooling, but I only have access to glibc 2.12. Installing binary bazel releases fail since they depend on glibc 2.14 and I have also been unable to build bazel 0.1.0/0.1.1/HEAD from scratch due to compilation errors. For now I have given up on making TensorFlow work on the cluster pending the issue I filed with bazel.
